SEARCH
Package edu.riccardomori.wordle.server

Class WordleServer

java.lang.Object
edu.riccardomori.wordle.server.WordleServer
All Implemented Interfaces:
serverRMI, Remote
public final class WordleServer extends Object implements serverRMI
This is the main server class. It is a singleton class. It is thread safe. It is responsible for: - Handling all the incoming connections with non-blocking channels - Handling the generation of the secret word - Authenticating the users - Implementing the remote methods - Managing the subscribers - Handling the notification over multicast

    • configure

      public void configure(String multicastAddress, int multicastPort, int tcpPort, int rmiPort, int swRate, String wordsDb)
      Configure the server.
      Parameters:
      multicastAddress - // IP address for the multicast notification service
      multicastPort - // Port number for the multicast notification service
      tcpPort - // The port for the server socket
      rmiPort - // The port for the RMI server
      swRate - // Refresh rate (in seconds) for the secret word
      wordsDb - // The file that contains all the secret words to choose from

      Returns:
      The full leaderboard

    • updateLeaderboard

      public void updateLeaderboard(String username, double score)
      Update the leaderboard by repositioning (updating its score) username. This might call the subscribers callback, in case there is a change in the first SUBS_THRESHOLD positions.
      Parameters:
      username - The user for which the score must be updated

    • shareGame

      public void shareGame(GameDescriptor game, String username)
      Share asynchronously a completed game in the multicast group
      Parameters:
      game - The game to be shared
      username - The user that played the game

    • notifySubscribers

      public void notifySubscribers()
      Notify all the subscribers by calling the callback registered. It runs in a separate thread

    • run

      public void run()
      The server main loop where it performs the multiplexing of the channels. The server must be previously configured by calling WotdleServer.configure()
